TITLE: Persistent Memory → Git Mirror: Stable Index, Pretty JSON, and Shard Guard (Complete Guide, v4)

Persistent Memory → Git Mirror: Stable Index, Pretty JSON, and Shard
Guard (Complete Guide, v4)
Objective: Keep MariaDB/Flask/Nginx as source-of-truth and publish a read‑only public
Git mirror (redacted JSON) that any AI assistant can read via HTTPS without headers or
POST. This document includes stable URLs, full exporter code, schemas, setup, cron,
verification, and troubleshooting.
1) RAW URLs for Assistants (Stable)
Use these RAW GitHub URLs. Replace ORG/REPO if your repo name changes.
Stable search map (always overwritten on export):
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HoffmanM361/memory-
mirror/main/catalog/search_map.json
Example shard (by tag):
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/HoffmanM361/memory-
mirror/main/catalog/shards/by_tag/memory.json
Generic patterns:
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ORG/REPO/main/catalog/search_map.json
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ORG/REPO/main/catalog/shards/by_tag/<tag>.json
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ORG/REPO/main/chunks/<chat_id>-<ix>.json

2) Public Mirror Layout
```
/catalog/
search_map.json # STABLE alias (always overwritten)
search_map_<nonce>.json # Rotating copy (optional)
shards/
by_tag/<tag>.json # Pretty-printed shard (size-guarded)
by_date/YYYY-MM.json
/chunks/
<id>-0.json # ~2 KB chunk
<id>-1.json
/meta/
latest_build.json # timestamp + exported count

counts.json # counts per tag/month
ai_diagnostics.json # freshness hints for AI
README.md
```
